intro: Leptorkis disticha, commonly known as the slender-leaved featherplant, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe and Asia. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are narrow and feather-like, giving it a delicate appearance, while its small white or yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters. Leptorkis disticha is often used in ornamental gardening for its aesthetic appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects.
